step1.title: Create Exchange Account
step1.description: Sign up on your chosen exchange and complete KYC verification if required. Ensure your account is fully verified and funded.
tips: Verify your email and phone number

step2.title: Generate API Keys
step2.description: Navigate to your exchange's API management section and create a new API key with appropriate permissions.
tips: Save your Secret Key securely (shown only once)
Whitelist Orbitra AI IP addresses if available

step3.title: Configure API Permissions
step3.description: Set the correct permissions for your API key to ensure secure trading operations.

step4.title: Add to Orbitra AI
step4.description: Copy your API credentials and add them to Orbitra AI platform.
tips: Go to Settings → API Settings in Orbitra AI
Select your exchange from the dropdown
Paste your API Key and Secret Key

step5.title: Test & Verify
step5.description: Test the connection to ensure everything is working correctly before going live.
tips: Use testnet/demo account first if available

faq.a1: Yes! Pro and Enterprise plans allow you to connect multiple exchange accounts simultaneously and trade across all of them from one dashboard.
faq.a2: Absolutely. We use bank-level AES-256 encryption to store your API keys. We only request read and trade permissions—never withdrawal permissions—so your funds remain 100% under your control.
faq.a3: It depends on the exchange. Binance, OKX, and KuCoin require KYC for most features. Bybit allows basic trading without KYC but with lower limits. We recommend completing KYC for full functionality.
faq.q4: What happens if my API key is compromised?
faq.a4: Immediately revoke the API key from your exchange account and generate a new one. Since we never request withdrawal permissions, your funds cannot be stolen even if the key is compromised. Update Orbitra AI with your new API credentials.
faq.q5: Can I test without real money?
faq.a5: Yes! Binance, OKX, Bybit, and KuCoin all offer testnet or demo accounts with virtual funds. We highly recommend testing your strategies there before using real capital.
